Dribbling around the square is a simple and effective warm-up to get players moving and working on dribbling.

[/et_pb_text][et_pb_image src=”https://ts-uploads.azureedge.net/marketing/2020/02/dribbling-around-the-square.png” align_tablet=”center” align_phone=”” align_last_edited=”on|desktop” _builder_version=”4.2.2″ max_width=”85%” max_width_tablet=”” max_width_phone=”” max_width_last_edited=”on|desktop” module_alignment=”center” hover_enabled=”0″][/et_pb_image][/et_pb_column][/et_pb_row][et_pb_row _builder_version=”3.25″ custom_padding=”4px|0px|33px|0px|false|false”][et_pb_column type=”4_4″ _builder_version=”3.25″ custom_padding=”|||” custom_padding__hover=”|||”][et_pb_text _builder_version=”4.2.2″ text_font=”|300|||||||” text_text_color=”#151516″ max_width=”70%” max_width_tablet=”” max_width_phone=”” max_width_last_edited=”on|desktop” module_alignment=”center” hover_enabled=”0″]

Set Up

Create a large square with a smaller square inside. Position four lines of players around the corners of the outer square. The first player in each line needs a ball.

[/et_pb_text][et_pb_text _builder_version=”4.2.2″ text_font=”|300|||||||” text_text_color=”#151516″ max_width=”70%” max_width_tablet=”” max_width_phone=”” max_width_last_edited=”on|desktop” module_alignment=”center” hover_enabled=”0″]

How It Works

Players dribble around the corresponding cone in the center, then dribble or pass to the next line in a rotation.

[/et_pb_text][et_pb_text _builder_version=”4.2.2″ text_font=”|300|||||||” text_text_color=”#151516″ max_width=”70%” max_width_tablet=”” max_width_phone=”” max_width_last_edited=”on|desktop” module_alignment=”center” hover_enabled=”0″]

Coaching Points

This exercise can work great in conjunction with a dynamic warm-up because the players will already be in lines. Coaches can have players perform different dynamic movements before adding balls. Once balls are in play, coaches can have players work on different turns, dribbling, or passing techniques.

As a rule of thumb, if there’s more than three players in a line, it’s best to build another grid so that there’s not too many players standing around at once.

 

[/et_pb_text][/et_pb_column][/et_pb_row][/et_pb_section]
